primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from the destructive power of envy (represented by Saul) to the freedom of love and abdication (represented by Jonathan and ultimately Jesus).

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ... emptied himself, and he came down to become a human being.
He stripped himself of his glory. He made himself vulnerable and killable all to lift us up.
The only way God’s salvation is going to come into your life is if you get off the throne
God is the most equitable and fair-minded judge
He did not begrudge us sitting with him on his throne
He loves us and he loves, therefore, seeing us get what we don’t deserve.

helper.identificatie: Jonathan (as a type/precursor) and the Holy Spirit (implied)
tekstueel_bewijs: Jonathan shows us the unenviousness of God in Jesus Christ.

tegenstander.identificatie: Envy / The 'Harmful Spirit' / The Human Ego (The Throne)
tekstueel_bewijs: Envy robs you of all joy.
sin is crouching at your door... it must master it.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Envy is treated as a 'deadly sin' that acts as a predatory animal (crouching tiger) and a judgment from God that destroys the will.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer's response: abdicating the throne of their own life.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.object: A life of love and service
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The hearer can only abdicate (Secondary) because they see Jesus has already abdicated for them (Primary).

voorbeelden_god_subject: He stripped himself of his glory.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: You compare your life to other lives.

voorbeelden: He loves seeing us get what we don’t deserve.
You have to understand all three to even understand the anatomy of it.
How can you be envious... when you know what you have?
He will give himself... completely to you.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Pouvoir' (Power) provided by the Gospel to overcome the 'Devoir' (Obligation) that the hearer cannot fulfill alone.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by Christ taking the 'punishment our envy deserves' so we can move to a state of abdication.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; envy is described as a 'brain tumor' and a 'predatory animal'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon contains many imperatives, they are grounded in the 'Subject-switch' where Jesus becomes the True Jonathan who acts on behalf of the incompetent human subject.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Focus on human anatomy of sin
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: You compare your life... you want their lives... you resent.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the primary actor in salvation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ... emptied himself... to lift us up.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Saul is a negative example; Jonathan is a positive example that points to Christ.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The preacher explicitly provides a theocentric alternative: 'Jesus is the true Jonathan'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and empowerment through the beauty of Christ's character.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Justification by grace alone precedes the ethical call to abdicate.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'anatomy of envy' to the 'work of Christ' is logically and narratively tight.
spanning_punten: The command 'Get off the throne' could be heard as moralistic if not for the preceding section on Christ's abdication.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The only way they can get what they don’t deserve is if I take what I don’t deserve.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon attributes the power to change to the 'vision' of Christ rather than the explicit work of the Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is an active force that 'does you' in the end.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully shifts the Subject from the Hearer (trying to stop envying) to Christ (who was unenvious for us).

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer might identify too much with the 'Subject' of the abdication.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that even the 'willingness' to abdicate is a gift.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Strong Savoir (knowing the anatomy) and Pouvoir (Christ's power).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The 'anatomy' section is necessary to make the 'remedy' meaningful.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Christ's work) clearly grounds Ethics (our abdication).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of moving from a psychological/moral problem to a Christocentric solution without losing the gravity of the human condition.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'three points' structure; Greimas reveals the Subject-switch from Saul/Hearer to Christ.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains 1 Samuel 18; semiotics explains how the sermon functions as a vehicle for grace.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'abdication' is not just a human task but a participation in the 'modal competence' of Christ.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses Jonathan as a 'Helper' actant that eventually merges with the 'Subject' actant (Christ).
